Node.definition: literally to pluck up (the tent pegs); hence: = action by which a relatively large company of humans, together with their possessions, departs from a place where they had set up a temporary residence

= location ◄ in Sinai (סִינַי) Peninsula, not far from the Sea of Reeds (יָם־סוּף) containing twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; ► the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) encamped there on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= desert; ◄ in Sinai (סִינַי) peninsula, between Sea of Reeds (יָם־סוּף) and Dophkah (דָּפְקָה) ► the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) encamped there on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= the area separating two or mores locations

= location ◄ in Sinai (סִינַי) Peninsula, not far from the Sea of Reeds (יָם־סוּף) containing twelve springs of water and seventy palm trees; ► the Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) encamped there on their way from Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) to Canaan (כְּנַעַן)
= the area separating two or mores locations
= mountain and surrounding desert on the Sinai Peninsula in Egypt, also known as Mount Horeb (חֹורֵב) ► location where YHWH (יהוה) entered into a covenant (בְּרִית) with Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל)

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= period of time, measured by a complete cycle in the phases of the moon
= state in which a countable entity is the second in a range

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= action by which humans express their dissatisfaction to those in charge
= a large gathering of humans or creatures ► usually for a specific purpose
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) brother of Moses (מֹשֶׁה) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► first high priest (כֹּהֵן)
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter

= a reference to an unknown person or deity; normally used with the purpose of identifying that person or deity; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that person or deity cannot be identified
= process by which humans or animals stop living, either spontaneously or as a result of an act of aggression
literally: hand, used metonymically to denote the owner of the hand; hence: = the person who is the originator of a particular event
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= action by which humans assume a sitting position in a certain location and remain in that position for some time; ≈ sometimes associated with a certain status, role, or common activity
= a rounded container ◄ usually made of ceramic or metal ► used for storage or cooking
= the soft substance in the body of humans and animals that consists of muscle tissue and fat
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= process by which someone's desire for food is fulfilled

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= state of having a lack of food for a period of time, affecting an individual for a short time or a large number of people in a geographical area for a prolonged time (as in famine)

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus
literally: to send rain; hence: = causative action by which deities cause objects to fall from the sky ◄ like rain
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

= the area above the earth, the location of sun, moon, and stars, the realm of the birds and God's primary residence; seen as the source of dew, rain, hail, snow, thunder and lightning, and sometimes even food; associated with what is high and remote, created by God and bound to disappear one day

Node.gloss: to go out|to come out|to go away|to leave|to depart
Node.definition: = action by which humans, animals, or objects leave a certain place or position
= causative action by which humans or animals bring together and take in objects from scattered places or sources

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine

Node.gloss: to test|to put to the test
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities make an effort to obtain information about (other) humans by observing them while they engage in a certain activity
marker denoting that the truth value of the following statement is under investigation
= process by which humans or deities follow a certain pattern of behavior, ◄ which is described as their journey through life
= causative action by which humans or deities offer instruction to (other) humans, ► aimed to teach the recipients wisdom and good behavior

= particle linking two events and denoting that X takes places in order to establish whether Y is true or not; X is often elided, which turns the remainder of the phrase into a question, which is often rhetorical

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= state in which a countable entity is the sixth in a range

Node.gloss: to prepare|to make ready|to make provisions (for something)
Node.definition: = causative action where humans or deities make objects ready for use

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner
= a linker introducing a proposition that gives additional information regarding an explicit or implicit object, location, time, or manner

= the time of day when the sun starts going down, when people leave their work and go home, have food, and go to sleep; this is also the time of the evening sacrifice, and the time when an unclean person who has gone through the cleansing rituals is declared clean, when fasting and mourning come to an end, and when the exposed body of an executed person needs to be removed

= referent to a male person or another object that is considered masculine

Node.gloss: to say|to speak|to tell|to command|to think|to call
Node.definition: = action by which humans and deities utter words; this can happen within their minds and be inaudible to others, but in most cases the words are spoken out loud in order to communicate something to others; usually directly followed by the actual words that are spoken
= man; ◄ son of Amram (עַמְרָם) and Jochebed (יֹוכֶבֶד) younger brother of Miriam (מִרְיָם) and Aaron (אַהֲרֹן) tribe of Levi (לֵוִי) ► leader of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) during exodus

= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
